name: Evangelical animation
description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

key_work.title: Devilman Crybaby
key_work.creator_credit: Go Nagai, Eunyoung Choi, Yohei Shintaku, Dynamic Planning and Science SARU
key_work.brief_description: Akira Fudo learns from his best friend Ryo Asuka that demons will revive and reclaim the world from humans. With humans hopeless against this threat, Ryo suggests combining with a demon. With this, Akira becomes Devilman, a being with the power of demon but with a human heart.

constellations_primary.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

start.title: Devilman Crybaby

end.title: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion
end.creator_credit: Hideaki Anno, Kazuya Tsurumaki, Mitsuhisa Ishikawa, GAINAX, Kadokawa Shoten, Movic, Production I.G, SEGA, Star Child Recording, Toei Company, TV Tokyo, Masao Shibata and Mitsuharu Haibara
end.brief_description: The second of two theatrically released follow-ups to the Neon Genesis Evangelion series about the battle between humanity and terrifying angels.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

links.description: Hideaki Anno’s cult classic anime took similar themes from the original Devilman, like humanity and Christianity. The classic shot of the Red Sea in The End of Evangelion pays homage to Devilman. The rebooted Devilman Crybaby also ends with a shot of a Red Sea.

end.title: Adventure Time
end.creator_credit: Cartoon Network Studios, Frederator Studios and Pendleton Ward

video_links.name: Adventure Time | Elements Arc TRAILER | Cartoon Network

end.brief_description: Hook up with Finn and Jake as they travel the Land of Ooo searching for adventure. But remember, adventure isn’t always easy.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

links.description: Adventure Time, although an animated children’s show, includes a subtle visual reference to Neon Genesis Evangelion in the episode “Jelly Beans Have Power”, with the antagonist behaving almost identically to one of the angels in Neon Genesis Evangelion.

end.title: South Park
end.brief_description: When South Park debuted in 1997, it became the first animated pop culture phenomenon since The Simpsons. Known for pushing boundaries and controversial satire, it follows four boys in a sleepy Colorado town but really traverses current events and pop culture.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

constellations_other.name: Religion, cinema and censorship
constellations_other.description: Religious narratives and themes have a complicated relationship with censorship, with creators pushing the boundaries for better or worse.

links.description: In the episode “A Nightmare on Facetime” the children of South Park celebrate Halloween by dressing up as pop-culture icons, this includes a character in the background that’s dressed as Finn from Adventure Time.

end.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus
end.brief_description: A British sketch comedy series with the shows being composed of surreality, risqué or innuendo-laden humour, sight gags and observational sketches without punchlines.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

links.description: The creators of South Park, Trey Parker and Matt Stone, took inspiration from the animation of the short, animated skits created by Monty Python and used a similar animation style for their show.

start.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus

end.title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
end.brief_description: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt concludes the story of the witcher Geralt of Rivia, the series’ protagonist, whose story to date has been covered in the previous installments. Geralt’s new mission comes in dark times as the mysterious and otherworldly army known as the Wild Hunt invades the Northern Kingdoms, leaving only blood soaked earth and fiery ruin in its wake; and it seems the Witcher is the key to stopping their cataclysmic rampage.

constellations_other.name: Evangelical animation
constellations_other.description: This Constellation exploring animation was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Melanie Kavanagh.

links.description: The Witcher 3 is a role-playing game created by CD Projekt that subtly references a Monty Python skit from The Holy Grail, the skit being about a small, killer rabbit. In The Witcher 3 players, can, indeed, be unexpectedly killed by a small, white rabbit.
